page.title: 12FARMING AROUND SLIMBRIDGE
page.content: Farming is by far the biggest occupation in the area with cattle outnumbering people by about three to one! However, there is arable as well as dairy farming. Grass is grown for silage which is kept and then fed to the cattle during the following winter. Vegetables and fruit, especially broad beans, strawberries and apples are also widely grown throughout the area. This all means that much of the landscape is rough grazing and cultivated fields particularly in the south and south-west where there are only about ten inhabitants per square kilometre. The milk from the various farms is collected every day and taken to the Milk Marketing Board depot at nearby Stonehouse.
